title: How to Make Taco Bell's Quesadillas

steps.headline: Add a little vegetable oil to a pan.
steps.description: Heat and cook the chicken pieces. Remove chicken from the pan and use a knife to cut them into thin slices.

steps.headline: Cook tortillas in a skillet one at a time, over medium heat.
steps.description: Lay one half slice of cheese on one side of each tortilla and then scatter the shredded cheeses on top of that.

steps.headline: Place about 1/4 cup of the chicken slices over the cheese.
Measure one tablespoon of the sauce and spread it on the empty side.
Gently and carefully, fold each tortilla in half so the edges meet.
steps.description: Flatten them slightly with a spatula.

steps.headline: Cook carefully until the cheese has just started to melt.
steps.description: Remove from the skillet and cut the quesadilla into four slices.

text: Add a little vegetable oil to a pan. Heat and cook the chicken pieces. Remove chicken from the pan and use a knife to cut them into thin slices. Cook tortillas in a skillet one at a time, over medium heat. Lay one half slice of cheese on one side of each tortilla and then scatter the shredded cheeses on top of that. Place about 1/4 cup of the chicken slices over the cheese.  Measure one tablespoon of the sauce and spread it on the empty side.  Gently and carefully, fold each tortilla in half so the edges meet. Flatten them slightly with a spatula. Cook carefully until the cheese has just started to melt. Remove from the skillet and cut the quesadilla into four slices. Finished.
